meanings.definition: A ceremonial dagger used in Wiccan and other pagan rituals.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the priestess held the athame high.
meanings.sent2: The athame was carefully passed from one coven member to another.
meanings.sent3: The athame seemed to shimmer with mystical energy as it was used in the ritual.
meanings.sent4: The athame, like a key, unlocked the spiritual realm for the participants.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming athame was a symbol of power and reverence in the sacred circle.

meanings.definition: To use an athame in a ritual.
meanings.sent1: She will athame the circle to mark the sacred space.
meanings.sent2: They athamed the elements to invoke the energies of nature.
meanings.sent3: He athamed with such focus that even the candles flickered in response.
meanings.sent4: The way she athamed seemed to draw the very essence of the earth into the circle.
meanings.sent5: Athaming with intention can amplify the energy of the ritual.
